did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult University Archives, Duke University.
did.abstract: The Office of the University Marshal is responsible for some of Duke University's most significant occasions: opening convocation, Founders' Day, and commencement. The University Marshal Records include correspondence, lists of candidates for degrees, memos, programs, financial records, records of the awarding of honorary degrees, minutes of the commencement committee, statistics, speeches, and other printed materials. Major subjects include information and procedures related to Founder's Day, baccalaureate services, convocations, and commencements; and files that detail the daily operation of the Office of the University Marshal. English.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.

For a period of twenty-five years from the origin of the material, permission in writing from the office of origin and the University Archivist is required for use. After twenty-five years, records that have been processed may be consulted with the permission of the University Archivist.

In accordance with the Family Education Rights and Privacy Act of 1974 as amended, Duke University permits students to inspect their education records and limits the disclosure of personally identifiable information from education records.
In off-site storage; 48 hours advance notice is required for use.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], University Marshal Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The University Marshal Records was received by the University Archives as a transfer in 1967 (A67-87), 1968 (A68-346), 1975 (A75-102), 1979 (A79-91), 1982 (A82-75), 1988 (A88-0025), 1993 (A93-82), and 2014 (UA2014.0081).

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession UA2014.0081 inventoried and added to finding aid by Tracy M. Jackson, December 2014.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Office of the University Marshal is responsible for organizing details and making decisions about the operation of some of Duke University's most significant occasions: opening convocation, Founders' Day, and commencement. The University Marshal holds both administrative and ceremonial responsibilities. The office's most public responsibility is to carry the University Mace and lead the procession at graduation. To many, the University Marshal's position is the embodiment of university traditions.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The University Marshal Records includes correspondence, lists of candidates for degrees, memos, programs, financial records, records of the awarding of honorary degrees, minutes of the commencement committee, statistics, speeches, and other printed materials. Major subjects include information and procedures related to Founder's Day, baccalaureate services, convocations, and commencements; and files that detail the daily operation of the Office of the University Marshal.

The University Marshall Records is arranged by accession date. These accessions are given in chronological order. The descriptions given for each box are general descriptions of the contents of the box and are not folder titles. There is some consistency in the contents of the boxes from one accession to another, but the folder titles are not identical.
Access to all folders in Box 3 is RESTRICTED. Please consult University Archives staff.

accessrestrict.p: Access to all folders in Box 3 is RESTRICTED. Please consult University Archives staff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes information about convocation, commencement, Founder's Day, baccalaureate services, honorary degrees, and the daily business of the Office of the University Marshal. The Office files include correspondence, memos, statistics, receipts, lists of dissertation titles, memos on ceremonial procedures, lists of degree candidates, information about diplomas, and information on honors and prizes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, nominations, committee meeting minutes, memos, and recommendations about the awarding of honorary degrees.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to all folders in Box 3 is RESTRICTED: Personal Privacy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes information about convocation, commencement, Founder's Day, baccalaureate services, honorary degrees, and the daily business of the Office of the University Marshal. This series also includes information about the Fuqua School of Business Dedication and the Robert H. James Dedication. The Office files include correspondence, statistics, receipts, lists of dissertation titles, memos on ceremonial procedures, lists of degree candidates, information about diplomas, and information on honors and prizes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes information about convocation, commencement, Founder's Day, baccalaureate services, honorary degrees, and the daily business of the Office of the University Marshal. The Office files include correspondence, statistics, receipts, lists of dissertation titles, memos on ceremonial procedures, lists of degree candidates, information about diplomas, and information on honors and prizes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These files were generally arranged by academic year, with the same file titles used each year. As in previous accessions, these files contain lists of candidates, commencement procedures, founders day, statistics, dedications, memorials, programs, invitations, committee meeting minutes, academic honors, trustee information, and correspondence, among other materials. Along with the files arranged chronologically by academic year, there are several files on assorted topics related to the duties of the University Marshal that are not interfiled chronologically, as well as files on equipment rentals in 2006-20007 (the rest of the files from this academic year were not with this accession).

This accession also includes materials related to the sesquicentennial celebrations in 1988 and 1999, as well as VHS video recordings of baccalaureate services and commencement exercises in 1997 and 2001, and audiocassette recordings of convocations, commencements, and baccalaureate services from 1990-2000.
